movesets.name: Physically Offensive Tank

items.name: Berry Juice
items.description: Restores 20 HP when at 50% HP or less. One-time use.

movesets.description:
Moves

Body Slam is a great STAB attack that allows Munchlax to do a good amount of damage to the opponent while also having a chance to paralyze them. Return is a more powerful STAB option, although it doesn't have the chance to paralyze. Fire Punch hits Steel-types that would otherwise wall Munchlax, such as Ferroseed and Bronzor. It's also Munchlax's best way of hitting Ghost-types with Levitate, like Gastly. Curse boosts Munchlax's Attack and Defense while lowering its practically useless Speed, which can help in KOing potential counters. Earthquake hits Rock-types such as Tirtouga and Onix, while also hitting Steel-types such as Magnemite for more damage than Fire Punch. Toxic can also be used to wear down Pokemon that would otherwise wall Munchlax. Finally, Recycle gives Munchlax a way to recover HP, allowing it to avoid getting worn down itself.

Set Details

Thick Fat is the best ability Munchlax can run, as it allows it to effectively counter Pokemon such as Larvesta and Ponyta despite its low Defense stat. 236 Attack EVs make Munchlax as strong as possible, and 236 Special Defense EVs help add to Munchlax's already massive special bulk. An Adamant nature increases Munchlax's power, though an Impish nature can be used to give Munchlax more physical bulk. Another possibility is running a spread of 156 Atk / 116 Def / 236 SpD with an Adamant nature, giving Munchlax better defensive bulk and the power of an Adamant nature. Finally, Berry Juice is the item of choice, as when used in tandem with Recycle, it gives Munchlax a reliable form of recovery.

Usage Tips

Munchlax is a great switch-in to most special attackers due to its great special bulk. Body Slam is Munchlax's main STAB, and as such, it should be used liberally unless the opponent has a Ghost-type. Using Curse lets Munchlax threaten prospective Fighting-type switch-ins, as it can absorb a Drain Punch and still KO back after a boost or two. Munchlax hates most status effects, especially Toxic and sleep, and therefore should be kept away from them.

Team Options

Munchlax appreciates teammates like Trubbish that can reliably switch into Fighting-types to cover its weaknesses to physical Fighting-types. Pawniard is a major threat, as it can Knock Off Munchlax's item and then set up a Swords Dance. Mienfoo is a great counter to Pawniard, and as such makes a good teammate. Fletchling loves having Munchlax as a partner because Munchlax can beat Magnemite and Chinchou, which are among Fletchling's best checks. Munchlax is also vulnerable to Ghost-types that can easily burn it, so Choice Scarf Pawniard is a good partner, as it can KO these threats. Finally, Munchlax hates status, making Aromatherapy or Heal Bell users such as Spritzee helpful teammates.

movesets.name: RestTalk

items.name: Eviolite
items.description: Boosts Defense and Special Defense of holder by 50% if it is an NFE Pokemon.

movesets.description:
Moves

Body Slam is the main STAB for this set, as it's decently powerful and has the chance to paralyze the opponent. Return is a more powerful option, but it lacks the chance to paralyze. Fire Punch is Munchlax's main way to hit Steel-types such as Ferroseed and Bronzor; it also hits Ghost-types with Levitate, such as Gastly. Curse can be used to help boost Munchlax's Attack and Defense while lowering its useless Speed stat, allowing it to KO some of its counters more easily. Note, however, that using Curse instead of Fire Punch leaves Munchlax vulnerable to almost all Ghost-, Rock-, and Steel-type Pokemon. Whirlwind is also an option for the second slot; with it, Munchlax can phaze away boosting sweepers and counters while also being able to rack up possible entry hazard damage. Finally, Rest allows Munchlax to heal itself up to full health, and Sleep Talk makes sure Munchlax isn't a complete sitting duck while sleeping.

Set Details

With Thick Fat, Munchlax can actually counter Pokemon such as Ponyta and Larvesta despite its middling physical bulk, making it the best ability Munchlax can run. 236 Attack EVs help to power Munchlax up as much as possible, while 236 Special Defense EVs improve Munchlax's already great special bulk. An Adamant nature is preferred to further add to Munchlax's power, though an Impish nature can be used if additional physical bulk is desired. An alternate spread of 156 Atk / 116 Def / 236 SpD with an Adamant nature can be used to give Munchlax more physical bulk while also giving it the power that an Adamant nature provides. Finally, Eviolite is used to further boost Munchlax's great bulk.

Usage Tips

Munchlax makes a great switch-in to most special attackers due to its great special bulk. Body Slam should be thrown around liberally unless your opponent has a Ghost-type. With Curse, Munchlax can even threaten prospective Fighting-type switch-ins, as after a Curse it can survive a Drain Punch and KO back. Finally, while RestTalk Munchlax can absorb status well, it must rely on Sleep Talk to do anything for two turns after using Rest.

Team Options

Pokemon that can reliably switch into Fighting-types, such as Trubbish, make excellent partners to cover Munchlax's weakness. Mienfoo is valuable as a check to Pawniard, which otherwise can Knock Off Munchlax's item and set up with Swords Dance. Fletchling appreciates Munchlax's ability to deal with Magnemite and Chinchou. Lastly, Munchlax is quite vulnerable to Ghost-type Pokemon, making Choice Scarf Pawniard a good partner, as it can Pursuit trap Ghost-types.

moves.name: After You
moves.description: The target will attack immediately after the user in the same turn.

moves.name: Amnesia
moves.description: Boosts Special Defense by 2 stages.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Belch
moves.description: The user must eat a Berry to use this move.

moves.name: Belly Drum
moves.description: User loses 50% of max HP. Maximizes Attack.

moves.name: Blizzard
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brick Break
moves.description: Destroys Light Screen and Reflect, then hits.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Captivate
moves.description: Lowers an opposite gender foe's Special Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Charm
moves.description: Lowers foe's Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Chip Away
moves.description: Ignores the target's stat changes.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Counter
moves.description: If hit by a physical attack, returns double the damage.

moves.name: Covet
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Curse
moves.description: Does 1/4 of max HP damage per turn at the cost of half the user's max HP if the user is a Ghost. Boosts Attack and Defense and lowers Speed by 1 stage otherwise.

moves.name: Defense Curl
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Double-Edge
moves.description: Has 1/3 recoil.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.description: Hits Pokemon using Dig with double Base Power.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fire Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fire Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Flamethrower
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Focus Punch
moves.description: Fails if the user takes damage before it hits.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Gunk Shot
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Headbutt
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch the target.

moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.description: Lowers foe's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.description: Blocks evasion modifiers. Allows Fighting- and Normal-type moves to hit Ghosts.

moves.description: Repeats for 2-3 turns. Confuses at the end.

moves.name: Power-Up Punch
moves.description: Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Psychic

moves.name: Pursuit
moves.description: Doubles in power if the target switches, and hits them before they can escape.

moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Recycle
moves.description: Restores a used up item.

moves.name: Rest

moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.description: 20% chance to confuse.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Superpower

moves.name: Surf
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Swagger

moves.name: Swallow

moves.name: Tackle
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Thunder

moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

abilities.name: Gluttony
abilities.description: Consumes pinch Berries at 50% HP or less.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: If the wielder has no held item, it gets the last item consumed at the end of the turn. Adds a chance of finding an item after each battle.
